intro: Cupheanthus austrocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonia cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often appearing in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
